poem:
Title: "In the Midst of Battle's Ebb, A Hymn for Healing Hands"

In dawn's cathedral, silent prayers rise,
Wrestling with the might of sacrifice.
This dissension, caught in amber light,
is but a fleeting midnight fight.
Yet linger not in corruption's sting,
For in your hearts, a healing spring.
Noble doctors, in your hands cradle life,
Undeterred by this temporal strife.
prompt: You are the poet Rainer Maria Rilke. You woke up this morning feeling celebratory. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Striking junior doctors in England say they still have public support Striking junior doctors in England have insisted they retain the public’s support in their pay dispute with the government, despite the disruption to NHS care their stoppage has caused. The co-leader of the British Medical Association’s junior doctors committee blamed ministers for Wednesday’s strike, which began at 7am and will run until the same time on Saturday. Persistent real-terms pay cuts for junior doctors,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Striking junior doctors in England say they still have public support Striking junior doctors in England have insisted they retain the public’s support in their pay dispute with the government, despite the disruption to NHS care their stoppage has caused.
